org.baswell.httproxy
Interface ProxyDirector

All Known Subinterfaces:
IOProxyDirector, NIOProxyDirector
All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleIODirector, SimpleNIOProxyDirector, SimpleProxyDirector
public interface ProxyDirector

Base interface for receiving proxy events and manipulating request & response headers. All implementations of this interface must be thread-safe.

Method Summary

Method Detail

getBufferSize

int getBufferSize()
Returns:
The size in bytes of the read buffer.

siftRequestHeader

java.lang.String siftRequestHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                                   java.lang.String headerValue,
                                   ProxiedRequest request)
Called for each header processed in a request. If a different value for this header needs to be sent to the server return a non-null value. If null is returned the header will be sent to the server unaltered.

Parameters:
headerName - The name of the request header.
headerValue - The value of the request header.
request - The proxied request.
Returns:
A non-null header value to alter what is sent to the server or null to send the header unaltered.

addRequestHeaders

java.util.List<Header> addRequestHeaders(ProxiedRequest request)
Parameters:
request - The proxied request.
Returns:
A list of additional of headers to send to the server or null to not add any headers.

siftResponseHeader

java.lang.String siftResponseHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                                    java.lang.String headerValue,
                                    ProxiedRequest request,
                                    ProxiedResponse response)
Called for each header processed in a response. If a different value for this header needs to be sent to the client return a non-null value. If null is returned the header will be sent to the client unaltered.

Parameters:
headerName - The name of the request header.
headerValue - The value of the request header.
request - The proxied request.
response - The proxied response.
Returns:
A non-null header value to alter what is sent to the server or null to send the header unaltered.

addResponseHeaders

java.util.List<Header> addResponseHeaders(ProxiedRequest request,
                                          ProxiedResponse response)
Parameters:
request - The proxied request.
response - The proxied response.
Returns:
A list of additional of headers to send to the client or null to not add any headers.

onExchangeComplete

void onExchangeComplete(ProxiedRequest request,
                        ProxiedResponse response)
Called when an request-response exchange has been completed.

Parameters:
request - The proxied request.
response - The proxied response.

onRequestHttpProtocolError

void onRequestHttpProtocolError(ProxiedRequest request,
                                java.lang.String errorDescription)
Called when a request could not be correctly parsed.

Parameters:
request - The proxied request.
errorDescription - A description of the protocol error.

onResponseHttpProtocolError

void onResponseHttpProtocolError(ProxiedRequest request,
                                 ProxiedResponse response,
                                 java.lang.String errorDescription)
Called when a response could not be correctly parsed.

Parameters:
request - The proxied request.
response - The proxied response.
errorDescription - A description of the protocol error.

onPrematureRequestClosed

void onPrematureRequestClosed(ProxiedRequest request,
                              java.io.IOException e)
Called when the client connection was closed before the request was fully read or the response was returned.

Parameters:
request - The proxied request.
e - The IO exception that signaled the close.

onPrematureResponseClosed

void onPrematureResponseClosed(ProxiedRequest request,
                               ProxiedResponse response,
                               java.io.IOException e)
Called when the server connection was closed before a response was retrieved.

Parameters:
request - The proxied request.
response - The proxied response.
e - The IO exception that signaled the close.

getLogger

ProxyLogger getLogger()
The logger used by the HttProxy runtime.

Returns:
A logger or null to disable logging.
